    • Method Detail

      • GetKeyState

        public boolean GetKeyState(KeyEvent keyEvent)
        This method gives the state of the button : pressed or released.
        Parameters:
        keyEvent - The event generated by the action on the button.
        Returns:
        A boolean that is true if the button is pressed and false if it is released.

      • GetKey

        public int GetKey(KeyEvent keyEvent)
        This method gives a number of the button that has generated the event.
        Parameters:
        keyEvent - The event generated by the action on the button.
        Returns:
        An integer that represent the button that has generated the event: 0 if it is none. 1 if it is A. 2 if it is B. 3 if it is X. 4 if it is Y. 5 if it is START. 6 if it is SELECT. 7 if it is R1. 8 if it is L1. 9 if it is R2. 10 if it is L2.

      • GetJ1PosX

        public double GetJ1PosX(MotionEvent motionEvent)
        This method gives the location of the joystick 1 on its axis x.
        Parameters:
        motionEvent - The event generated by the action on the joystick.
        Returns:
        A decimal number that is the coordinate of the joystick 1 on its axis x.

      • GetJ1PosY

        public double GetJ1PosY(MotionEvent motionEvent)
        This method gives the location of the joystick 1 on its axis y.
        Parameters:
        motionEvent - The event generated by the action on the joystick.
        Returns:
        A decimal number that is the coordinate of the joystick 1 on its axis y.

      • GetJ2PosX

        public double GetJ2PosX(MotionEvent motionEvent)
        This method gives the location of the joystick 2 on its axis x.
        Parameters:
        motionEvent - The event generated by the action on the joystick.
        Returns:
        A decimal number that is the coordinate of the joystick 2 on its axis x.

      • GetJ2PosY

        public double GetJ2PosY(MotionEvent motionEvent)
        This method gives the location of the joystick 2 on its axis y.
        Parameters:
        motionEvent - The event generated by the action on the joystick.
        Returns:
        A decimal number that is the coordinate of the joystick 2 on its axis y.

      • GetDPad

        public int GetDPad(MotionEvent motionEvent)
        This method gives a number that represents the direction pressed on the directional pad.
        Parameters:
        motionEvent - The event generated by the action on the directional pad (considered as a joystick).
        Returns:
        An integer that represent the direction pressed on the directional pad: 0 if it is none. 1 if it is UP. 2 if it is RIGHT. 3 if it is DOWN. 4 if it is LEFT.
